destination

sessionId

totalSize

length

protected int length

flag

protected int flag
0x00 - no flag 0x02 - Reply to a received message 0x08 - error on the binary level 0x20 - User Display Image or Emoticions. 0x01000030 - Data of a file.

ackSessionId

protected int ackSessionId
The seventh field is a DWORD and is an important field, if the SessionID field is zero and the data doesn't contain the SessionID then this field contains the Identifier of the previous received message, most of the time the Flag field is 0x2 then. If the data contains the SessionID or if the SessionID field is non-zero then this field is just some random generated number.

ackUniqueId

protected int ackUniqueId

ackLength

protected long ackLength

data

protected byte[] data

applicationId

protected int applicationId
The 4-byte binary footer consists of 1 DWORD which is in Little Endian order and that field represents the ApplicationIdentifier (AppID). If this field is zero, then the Clients are negotiating about the session. The ApplicationIdentifier is 0x1 for User Display Images and Emoticons, 0x2 for File Transfers, and for Games it's specified by the Start Menu code.

segmented

protected boolean segmented
